page.title: 03The Coastline
page.content: The coast runs roughly E-W.The beach is mainly pebbles,protected at many points by groynes.There is some concrete sea wall along the coast to protect the promenade at St.Leonard's and other potential inundation points. Sandstone cliffs at Glyne Gap are still being undercut.Notices warn the public not to walk near the cliff edge.Longshore drift still carries pebbles eastwards.A few small diesel- engined fishing boats at W.St.Leonards still work the inshore waters.Swimming sailing and sailboarding take place, and many beach huts which are just above high water mark are often damaged or smashed by stormy seas. Rubbish is strewn on the beach near these,washed up by the sea or deposited from landward.Plastic wrappings and containers abound,as do metal drink cans.
